alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 1:11PM MST until August 14 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 415 PM MST. * At 111 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sedona, Village At Oak Creek, Red Rock State Park and Manzanita Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 302 and 315...and near mile marker 317. State Route 179 between mile markers 305 and 313. State Route 89A between mile markers 365 and 380. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Verde River, Coffee Creek, Rattlesnake Canyon, Dry Beaver Creek, Dry Creek, Jacks Canyon, Spring Creek, Rarick Canyon, Sycamore Creek, Oak Creek, Turkey Creek and West Fork Oak Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
